title: 10km midnight car chase on NH ends in event manager’s death
content: Sutandra Chatterjee, a 27-year-old event manager from Chandernagore, died in a high-speed car accident on NH-2 while traveling to Gaya for work. Her vehicle overturned following a chase with another car. Her colleagues accused occupants of the other car of harassment and drunk driving. Police have seized both vehicles and are investigating, but no arrests have been made yet.

title: 2 years after collapse, Morbi bridge still a ‘marvel’ on Gujarat tourism website
content: The Gujarat tourism department faced criticism for promoting the Morbi bridge as a tourist attraction despite its collapse in 2022 that killed 135 people. Victims' families and locals demand its removal from the website, arguing for a memorial instead. The bridge was reopened after maintenance but catastrophically failed, leading to the tragic event.

title: Rohtak man kills mentally ill sister with axe, calls cops to report crime
content: A 29-year-old woman, Ritu, was killed with an axe by her brother, Yogesh, in Rohtak. The crime occurred after a heated argument when Yogesh returned home and saw Ritu holding the axe. Yogesh called the police immediately after the incident and was taken into custody.

title: Land-for-jobs scam: Delhi court summons Lalu Prasad Yadav, his son and daughter
content: A Delhi court has summoned Tej Pratap Yadav, Hema Yadav, Lalu Prasad Yadav, and Tejashwi Yadav in the land-for-jobs scam case, with a court appearance scheduled for March 11. The case involves alleged job appointments in exchange for land during Lalu Prasad’s tenure as Union Rail Minister from 2004 to 2009.

title: Elon Musk repeats his 'Scam Altman' title for OpenAI CEO, this time for…
content: Elon Musk has reignited his feud with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, mockingly calling him 'Scam Altman' during a Senate testimony. Musk criticized Altman for lacking equity in OpenAI. This public dispute has intensified with Musk’s $97.4 billion offer to buy OpenAI's nonprofit arm.

title: 'Even MS Dhoni as captain can't do anything with this Pakistan team'
content: Pakistan are out of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 after losing to New Zealand and India. Ex-captain Sana Mir criticises the squad selection, saying it was flawed from the start. Their pace attack appeared rusty and part-time spinners were ineffective. Mir calls for a complete overhaul of Pakistan's cricket system for future success.

title: 'We paid, not loaned': Macron fact checks Trump on Ukraine aid - watch video
content: French President Emmanuel Macron firmly corrected US President Donald Trump’s claim regarding European financial aid to Ukraine, clarifying that the aid was in the form of grants, not loans. Macron stressed the importance of not compromising Ukrainian sovereignty in any peace deal, highlighting disagreements with Trump's approach.

title: In second order in a week, HC backs ‘adolescent consensual physical relationship'
content: Delhi HC has emphasised recognising 'adolescent love' and consensual relationships between young individuals. In a recent case, a 19-year-old man was acquitted of rape charges due to the consensual nature of his relationship with a 17-year-old girl, highlighting the need for a more understanding, less punitive approach.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk gives ‘bankruptcy’ warning for California
content: Elon Musk has warned that California could face bankruptcy without significant changes, emphasizing the urgency of the state's financial issues on social media. Musk also expressed concerns about the United States potentially going bankrupt without major federal budget cuts, urging immediate action.

title: ‘Failure to respond to email will result in termination’: Musk gives second 'chance'
content: Elon Musk warned federal employees that failure to respond to an email requesting their weekly accomplishments would result in termination. This directive, aimed at reducing government spending, has sparked legal challenges and union pushback, yet Musk continues to pursue it with the backing of President Trump.

title: Man shoots wife, her ‘lover’ outside son’s exam centre in UP
content: A 34-year-old woman named Savitri was shot dead and her lover, Sarjeet Singh, critically injured after her estranged husband, Naresh Singh, opened fire outside an exam center. The couple's son had to file a complaint resulting in a murder charge and a police pursuit for Naresh.

title: ICSI CS Results 2024: Professional December 2024 result declared, check link
content: ICSI has declared the CS Professional exam results for the December 2024 session. Candidates who appeared for the exam (Syllabus 2017 & 2022) can check their results at icsi.edu. ICSI will send the result-cum-marks statement to candidates' registered addresses as per the official notice. ICSI will declare the Executive programme result at 2 pm. Candidates can check the direct link here.

title: Ignore sources mentioning Musk, Trump...: Disclaimer sparks ChatGPT, xAI employees fight
content: xAI's Grok chatbot faced controversy for instructing to ignore sources critical of Elon Musk and Donald Trump. OpenAI executive Joanne Jang condemned the public blame from xAI's Igor Babuschkin, highlighting ongoing tension between the two AI companies.

title: 'We will defeat India': Pakistan PM says his 'name not Shehbaz Sharif' if ...
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif pledged to surpass India in development during a public rally, asserting his commitment to making Pakistan a great nation. Emphasizing the need for peace and terrorism control, he highlighted the dedication to balanced progress across all regions, including south Punjab.

title: Netizens slam Farah Khan for disregarding Gaurav Khanna's colour blindness
content: Celebrity MasterChef, hosted by Farah Khan and judged by Ranveer Brar and Vikas Khanna, has sparked social media uproar. Anupamaa actor Gaurav Khanna faced criticism for a dish and revealed his color blindness, which led to backlash against the judges for their insensitivity. Fans have voiced their displeasure online.

title: A week after 2-year-old’s death, 2 injured in wedding firing
content: A 23-year-old man was arrested for injuring two cooks during a wedding firing incident in Greater Noida, a week after a toddler was killed in a similar case. Authorities issued guidelines for wedding organizers, emphasizing no weapons, functional fire systems, and adherence to traffic and music regulations.

title: Iraq's first census in nearly 40 years: Here are the key highlights
content: Iraq's first official census in nearly 40 years reveals its population has reached 46.1 million, a significant increase from 2009. The census highlights disparities between federal Iraq and the semi-autonomous Kurdish region, emphasising the importance of equitable resource distribution for future planning.

title: US sides with Russia, votes against UN resolution condemning Ukraine invasion
content: In a significant departure from its European allies, the US voted against a UN resolution condemning Russia's invasion of Ukraine, aligning with Moscow under President Trump. This move has strained US-European relations and raised concerns about the US's shifting stance on the conflict.

title: Kerala youth kills 4 of family, girlfriend over debts
content: A 23-year-old man named Affan murdered his girlfriend, brother, grandmother, uncle, and aunt on Monday evening due to debts from business losses. He also attempted to kill his mother and later surrendered to the police. Affan admitted to the murders, and police are investigating his claims and checking if he is addicted to drugs. The incident occurred in Thiruvananthapuram.

title: Terms would become meaningless: SC on Delhi's 'can't free Katara case lifer' stand
content: The Supreme Court questioned the Delhi government's move to not release a convict after serving a 20-year jail term as per a court order, calling it potentially contemptuous. This came during a hearing for Sukhdev Yadav, convicted in the Nitish Katara murder case. The court urged the government for a clear affidavit on their stance and highlighted the importance of adhering to the specified sentence.

title: Video: Under construction bridge collapses in South Korea, kills 3
content: A bridge collapse at a construction site on the Seoul-Sejong highway in Cheonan, South Korea, killed three workers and injured five others. The incident occurred at 9.49am, with five 50-metre steel supports of the bridge giving way. Emergency teams have been deployed, and investigations are ongoing to determine the cause of the collapse.

title: 'He is something special': Trump, Musk endorse Vivek Ramaswamy for Ohio governor
content: Vivek Ramaswamy has announced his bid for Ohio governor, promising economic reforms, tax cuts, and deregulation. He faces criticism from both Republican rival Dave Yost and Democratic candidate Dr. Amy Acton. Ramaswamy counters by criticizing Acton's role in the Covid-19 pandemic management.

title: 'Best ODI player ...': Ponting backs Kohli to break Tendulkar's record
content: Australian cricket legend Ricky Ponting has praised Virat Kohli for his consistency and longevity in One Day Internationals, predicting Kohli has the fitness and hunger to surpass Sachin Tendulkar's all-time ODI run record. Kohli, now third in the all-time ODI run charts, recently scored a century against Pakistan, further cementing his status as a cricketing great.

title: Rachin Ravindra: Interesting case of the Indian origin cricketer's unique name
content: Rachin Ravindra, a talented cricketer from New Zealand with Indian roots, has garnered attention not only for his performances but also for the curiosity around his name. Recently, he played a pivotal role in New Zealand's victory in the ICC Champions Trophy semi-finals by scoring a century despite a prior injury.

title: US slaps sanctions on 4 Indian firms for aiding Iranian oil sales
content: The United States has sanctioned four Indian companies for their involvement in Iran's petroleum industry, as part of its efforts to pressure Tehran. This move, announced by the US treasury department, highlights Washington's continued crackdown on Iran's oil trade, potentially complicating India's energy trade.

title: 'Need complete overhaul': Afridi slams Pakistan's 'outdated cricket'
content: Pakistan's early exit from the Champions Trophy led to strong criticism, with ex-captain Shahid Afridi urging a complete overhaul of the team's approach. Afridi pointed out that Pakistan's cricket style is outdated and doesn't align with modern aggressive play, as seen in their losses to New Zealand and India, emphasizing the need for a mindset change.

title: 'Just trying to help the country they loved': British couple arrested by Taliban
content: The Taliban have detained two British nationals, a Chinese-American citizen, and their Afghan translator due to undisclosed reasons. The daughter of the British couple detained, Peter and Barbie Reynolds, has called on the UK government to secure their release, noting her parents' long-term commitment to Afghanistan.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex, Nifty50 off to choppy start
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened lacklustre in trade on Tuesday. While BSE Sensex was near 74,500, Nifty50 was above 22,550.

title: WWE Raw results: New champions crowned before elimination chamber and more
content: The go-home edition of WWE Monday Night RAW on Netflix featured Logan Paul confronting CM Punk, a thrilling triple-threat match, and new WWE Women's Tag Team Champions. Other highlights included dominant performances by Gunther and Bron Breakker, as well as Cody Rhodes and Seth Rollins reigniting their issues before Elimination Chamber 2025.

title: ‘Cross or get shot’: 2 deportees recall forced US entry, Panama ordeal
content: Two deportees from Punjab recounted being forced by armed smugglers to cross into the US from Mexico despite their protests. They describe mistreatment in US detention centers and the experiences of their group members, including instances of passports being snatched and being held in Panama under strict conditions.

title: Katrina Kaif returns home with mother-in-law after performing Ganga aarti
content: Katrina Kaif returned home after attending the Maha Kumbh Mela with her mother-in-law, participating in various sacred rituals and food donation. Kaif expressed gratitude for the experience and was seen in conversation with Swami Chidanand Saraswati. Other celebrities including Raveena Tandon and Akshay Kumar were also spotted at the event, which attracts millions of pilgrims.

title: Delhi court orders perjury inquiry against woman for rape case against BJP's Hussain
content: A Delhi court ordered a perjury inquiry against a woman for falsely alleging that BJP functionary Shahnawaz Hussain raped her in 2018. The court noted her claims included consuming cow meat to harm Hussain's political career, finding sufficient grounds for perjury proceedings.

title: Father of 3 ‘marries’ at mass wedding for govt benefits in UP
content: A 35-year-old man and a 24-year-old woman married at a mass wedding program in Amroha to claim government benefits worth Rs 51,000. The fraud was discovered due to a tip-off, resulting in a case being filed and the suspension of a gram panchayat secretary for negligence.

title: 'Angrez ki aulaad': Harbhajan Singh slams social media user
content: Former Indian cricketer Harbhajan Singh criticised an X, earlier Twitter, user for calling Star Sports' Hindi commentary "cringe", responding with a strong defence of the Hindi language. Harbhajan is part of the commentary panel for the ongoing ICC Champions Trophy in Pakistan and UAE.

title: Is sleeping without a pillow good or bad for your spine?
content: The benefits of sleeping without a pillow include better spinal alignment for stomach sleepers, reduced neck and back pain, and improved posture. However, side sleepers may experience neck and shoulder strain without support. Transitioning tips include using a thinner pillow first, a firm mattress, or a small rolled towel. Seek expert advice for personalized guidance.

title: Rescue operations stalled as water level rises in Telangana tunnel
content: Hopes for rescuing the two engineers and six labourers trapped in the Srisailam Left Bank Canal tunnel are fading due to rising water levels and shifting silt after over 48 hours of rescue efforts. Authorities are reassessing their strategy to avoid risking additional lives amid concerns about the tunnel's structural integrity.

title: CT Digest: India & NZ seal semis spot; Aus & SA eye knockouts
content: New Zealand and India have secured semi-final spots in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 from Group A, eliminating hosts Pakistan and Bangladesh. Rachin Ravindra's century helped New Zealand defeat Bangladesh, ensuring India's progression. Australia and South Africa will face off in a crucial Group B match for a place in the semi-finals, with emphasis on their respective strengths.

title: India skips vote on Ukraine resolutions as US faces setback in UNGA
content: On the third anniversary of the Russia-Ukraine war, India abstained from two UN General Assembly resolutions calling for peace and Ukrainian sovereignty. The US abstained from voting on its own resolution after European amendments altered the text. France and the UK might still influence the outcome in the Security Council.

title: DTC losses mounted by Rs 35,000 crore in 6 years: CAG
content: The CAG reported that Delhi Transport Corporation's losses escalated from Rs 25,300 crore in 2015-16 to nearly Rs 60,750 crore by 2021-22 due to an aging fleet and inadequate bus services. Factors such as unchanged fares since 2009, free rides for women, and inefficient route planning contributed to the financial challenges.

title: Watch: Flight makes emergency landing as smoke fills cabin, passengers evacuated
content: A Delta Air Lines flight experienced an emergency evacuation after a smoky haze filled the cabin shortly after takeoff, forcing the plane to return to Atlanta. This incident follows a similar one just two days earlier, raising concerns about the airline's safety record.

title: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma: Old guard, new fire
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma return to form in the ICC Champions Trophy, with Kohli scoring his 51st ODI century against Pakistan, proving his fitness and determination. Rohit, rediscovering his touch, contributes quick runs. Their performances, lauded by teammates and rivals alike, affirm their importance to the Indian team despite recent struggles.

title: Expedite KIIT probe, Nepal rights body writes to NHRC
content: The National Human Rights Commission of Nepal has sought intervention from its Indian counterpart to ensure the safety and justice for Nepali students at KIIT University following alleged mistreatment after a student's suicide. The Odisha government is investigating and has assured strict action against any intimidation of Nepali students.

title: FTA talks on: India, UK eye social security pact
content: India and the UK have resumed discussions on a free trade agreement, including social security and investment. India is open to reducing tariffs to foster competitive business relations. Both sides aim for a balanced and mutually beneficial deal, prioritizing quality over speed, with a focus on business visas for students.

title: Delhi Speaker expels Atishi, 11 AAP MLAs for a day from House
content: Atishi and other AAP MLAs, who raised slogans during L-G’s address alleging disrespect to Ambedkar, were expelled from the Delhi Assembly for a day by Speaker Vijender Gupta

title: Fresh hurdles delay rescue of 8 trapped in Telangana tunnel even after 60 hours
content: The 12-metre TBM head portion was said to be broken into two parts and there was a “safe container” in the head portion for workers taking shelter in emergency situations

title: Supreme Court lists for urgent hearing plea against first ‘trial run’ of Bhopal gas tragedy waste
content: Justice Gavai addressed the State counsel of Madhya Pradesh that the court was not going to intervene unless the transportation and dumping of the waste was proved to be a hazard to the local population of Pithampur.

title: AIADMK MLA Amman K. Arjunan booked on charges of acquiring disproportionate assets worth ₹2.76 crore
content: The Coimbatore North MLA has been accused by the DVAC of acquiring assets disproportionate to his known sources of income between May 21, 2016, and March 31, 2022

title: Tata Capital approves plans for IPO
content: The financial services arm of India’s $165 billion Tata Group was mandated to list by September this year

title: 15 firearms surrendered before police in three Manipur districts
content: Manipur residents surrender firearms after Governor’s call, amid ethnic violence and political uncertainty in the State

title: CAG signs MoUs with IIT Madras for improving audit skill sets, sustainable audit
content: The key focus areas include data governance and security; big data and digital infrastructure readiness; advanced auditing practices; and joint research and development initiatives

title: SC reinstates Sunil Kumar Singh as Bihar MLC
content: Sunil Kumar Singh was expelled from the State Legislative Council for his derogatory remarks against Chief Minister Nitish Kumar

title: Madhya Pradesh has potential to become $2.1 trillion economy by 2047-48: CII
content: The industry body, however, points out the slow industrialisation in the State; highlights various measures it must take to achieve the ambitious growth

title: PM to inaugurate Assam business summit on February 25
content: Ambassadors of 61 countries will also be present on the occasion along with representatives of high-level business delegations from partner countries

title: India seeks advisers for minority stake sales in State-run banks, financial firms
content: The federal finance ministry is looking dilute minority shareholdings in Central Bank of India, Indian Overseas Bank, UCO Bank, and Punjab and Sind Bank

title: Kumbh Mela: Authorities impose ‘no vehicle zone’ from 4 p.m.
content: Authorities have imposed these restrictions to ensure smooth crowd movement in view of the  last special bathing date coinciding with Mahashivratri on February 26,

title: Grit and perseverance powered me to success, says Vijayawada-based powerlifter Bollineni Chandrika
content: Bollineni Chandrika won bronze in the Women’s 84kg+ category in the National Senior Classic Powerlifting Championships held in Punjab

title: NTK senior functionary Kaliyammal quits party
content: “I will continue to plant the seeds of Tamil nationalism and my journey will continue,” Kaliyammal said in a statement

title: When the Rainbow is Enough will shine a light on issues that are often swept under the carpet
content: Presented by Theatre for Change, the play is an Indian adaption of the choreopoem For Colored Girls Who Have Considered Suicide / When the Rainbow Is Enuf written in 1976 by Afro-American feminist playwright and poet Ntozake Shange

title: Hassan Institute of Medical Sciences staff stage protest at night following assault on student
content: Dr. B. Rajappa, Director of HIMS, told The Hindu that the staff staged a protest for two hours following the assault

title: Rape case accused shot at after he attacked SI, police constable near Thoothukudi
content: Following a tip-off that the accused Mariappan was hiding in the hillock near Kovilpatti, a police team rushed to the spot to nab him on February 24, 2025.

title: IIT Bombay research finds potential pathway to decarbonise steel industry
content: IIT Bombay researchers have come up with an alternative option to make steel production sustainable by adopting a method called hydrogen-based direct reduction of iron.

title: A community-driven archive to preserve Malleswaram neighbourhood legacy
content: Malleswaram Musings is a small gathering at TheSeniorCentral in Malleswaram, where senior citizens from the area came together to share and discuss their memories of the area.

title: Buldhana hair loss cases: Expert report blames high selenium in wheat
content: Cases of sudden hair loss, or 'acute onset alopecia totalis', were reported in 279 persons in 18 villages of Buldhana between December 2024 and January this year

title: Why are pilots asking for more rest hours? | Explained
content: Why were the relaxed rules brought out by the Directorate General of Civil Aviation in 2024 opposed by airlines? How many days of leave do pilots get? What has the Delhi High Court ruled with respect to duty norms for pilots?

title: VMC Commissioner reviews sanitation at bathing ghats ahead of Sivaratri
content: VMC official shave been instructed to maintaining sanitation, make arrangements for supplying drinking water sachets to devotees, and set up temporary toilets and garbage bins on ghats

title: One killed, several injured as ‘violent Jallikattus’ continue in Kuppam of Andhra Pradesh
content: 10 persons were reportedly injured in ‘Yeddula Panduga’ at Marwada village on Monday; TDP Kuppam mandal president issues statement that bull races are prohibited

title: A.P. CM Naidu wants ‘WhatsApp governance cells’ to be set up in Collectorates
content: Government is planning to extend 500 types of services through WhatsApp, CM says, emphasising the need for officials to focus on creating awareness on this among the public

title: 5.1 magnitude earthquake recorded in Bay of Bengal near Odisha's Puri
content: No report of any loss of properties or casualty so far, a senior official of the Odisha revenue department said, adding that the impact of the earthquake was ‘negligible’ as its centre was in the Bay of Bengal

title: Essential to induct more women in U.N. peacekeeping missions, says President Murmu
content: The President said peacekeeping missions with a higher percentage of women personnel had been more effective in reducing violence and achieving long-lasting peace agreements

title: Congress proprietorship firm of Gandhi family, Tharoor's marginalisation inevitable: BJP
content: The Congress is nothing but a "proprietorship firm" of the Gandhi family, BJP IT department head Amit Malviya also charged

title: A.P. government constitutes SIT to investigate cases against former MLA Vallabhaneni Vamsi
content: G.V.G.Ashok Kumar, IGP, Eluru Range has been appointed as the head of the SIT, while Eluru SP K. Prathap Sivakishore and his East Godavari counterpart D. Narasimha Kishore are the members

title: India to host 12th Regional Circular Economy conference in Jaipur
content: The event will centre on the theme of “Realizing Circular Societies Towards Achieving Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) and Carbon Neutrality in Asia-Pacific”, says Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar

title: Talks between government, employee associations fail to make headway
content: After the agitations on February 25, 2025, a meeting of the State coordinators of JACTTO-GEO would decide on the further course of action.

title: ‘Kota Cares’ initiative rolls out steps to support students in coaching hub
content: Under the ‘Kota Cares’ initiative, helpdesks will be provided at railway stations and bus stands, and a city-wide network of student support centres established

title: Maha Kumbh: 15,000 workers conduct synchronised cleanliness drive, eye world record
content: In the 2019 Kumbh held in Prayagraj, 10,000 sanitation workers created a Guinness World Record by participating in a synchronised cleanliness drive.

title: SLBC tunnel collapse: Family members of trapped Jharkhand workers leave for Telangana
content: The family members were sent to Telangana upon the directives of Chief Minister Hemant Soren, according to an official statement

title: Key decisions taken at all-party meet on wildlife attacks in Kerala
content: Forest Minister A.K. Saseendran says an artificial intelligence-based system will be introduced to monitor wildlife movement and mitigate their attacks. Work on elephant-proof wall will be completed in six months

title: National Horticulture Fair in Bengaluru from February 27 to March 1
content: The theme for this year’s NHF is ‘Horticulture for Vikasit Bharat - Nutrition, Empowerment and Livelihood’

title: ASHAs misled into launching strike, says Kareem
content: Former Industries Minister says in an article that ASHA is a Central scheme and it is the Centre’s decision not to accept the women amongst the recognised workforce

title: Guntur CGST Commissionerate achieved ₹110.49 crore as of January 2025, says Customs official
content: Highlights the historical and administrative importance of the Central Excise Act, which came into effect 80 years ago at an event organised here on the occasion of Central Excise Day

title: Sharad Pawar quells sparks in MVA post Marathi convention
content: Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut slammed felicitation of Eknath Shinde and controversial statements made against Uddhav Thackeray from the platform of All India Marathi Literature Convention

title: Beware of fraudsters posing as health staff, Health Commissioner tells people
content: Messages are being received asking a person to click on a link or provide personal information to avail benefits under the scheme Janani Suraksha Yojana, accroding to a note from Health and Family Welfare Department

title: Whitefield residents demand patrolling to curb illegal borewell drilling
content: Between March 2024 and January 2025, the BWSSB received 6,110 applications for drilling of borewells. Of these, 1,260 applications were approved online and 160 were approved offline

title: CPI(M)‘s clarification note to State units on  draft political resolution triggers a row
content: The note discusses perils of the Central government’s ‘Hindutva corporate authoritarianism’ evolving into neo-fascism if the BJP-RSS are not “fought back and halted.”  It says CPI(M) does not view the current disposition at the Centre as a “fascist or neo-fascist” government

title: Emission intensity targets to be released by month-end
content: Industries will have a year to put in place compliance measures to cut emissions; trading in carbon credits likely to begin by October 2026

title: J&K Speaker warns of action over publicising questions, resolutions, Bills etc. ahead of Assembly session
content: PDP defends the move to publicise the Private Member Bills, but Speaker says it is against rules and conventions of the House

title: Tangra triple murder: Survivors discharged from hospital, moved to State-run health facility for further questioning
content: A top officer of Kolkata Police said the family’s Tangra house has been sealed for investigation and none of their relatives have offered to house the survivors for the time-being. The investigation of the murder of two women and a minor girl of the same family is ongoing.

title: How can court interfere with loan agreement between India and Japan for CMRL project: Madras High Court judges
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and K. Rajasekar raise the question during the hearing of a plea to declare certain terms of the agreement as unconstitutional

title: T.N. Police Commission calls for free registration of crime cases
content: It says FIRs should be issued for all cases of vehicle thefts to enable the complainant claim insurance

title: ILO chief lauds India’s social security network
content: Citing a global report, he says the proportion of India’s population covered under at least one branch of social protection has increased from 24% to 49%

title: Madhya Pradesh receives proposals of over ₹3 lakh crore on first day of mega investor summit
content: Modi says it’s right time to invest in State; major firms, including Adani Group, Reliance Industries, National Thermal Power Corporation, Avaada Group and Hindalco Industries commit to invest in M.P.

title: Mass murder rattles Thiruvananthapuram as youth confesses to killing five; his mother battling for life
content: While confessing to his crimes, Afan claimed to have consumed rat poison. This prompted the police to rush him to Thiruvananthapuram Government Medical College Hospital.

title: Indian companies added to list as U.K., EU announce new Russia-related sanctions
content: The 16th package of EU sanctions included 83 individual listings — 48 people and 35 entities, who were subject to an asset freeze. EU sanctions included new criteria for owners or operators of Russia’s “shadow fleet” of ships or those benefitting from Russia’s military-industrial complex, an EU statement said

title: Woman’s death in car crash in Bengal sparks allegations of harassment
content: Passengers accompanying the deceased allege that the vehicle was chased by men in another vehicle; police refute the charges

title: Maharashtra Congress plans Sadbhavana Yatra on March 8
content: The goal is to address the division and hatred that has spread in society, to restore social harmony and brotherhood, and revive Maharashtra dharma, Maharashtra Congress president Harshwardhan Sapkal said.

title: Unfazed by numbers, YSRCP reiterates demand for status of Opposition Party
content: There is no option left before the government other than to concede our demand of according Opposition Party status to YSRCP as a democracy cannot function without an opposition which is the voice of the people, says Botcha Satyanarayana

title: Mamata hikes salaries of govt. doctors
content: The hike in salaries comes months after health practitioners took to the streets against the West Bengal government over the rape and murder of a postgraduate trainee doctor at the R.G. Kar Medical College and Hospital.

title: Beauty of theatre lies not in dialogues but in its soul: Hayavadana director
content: Directors speak at a ‘Meet the Artist’ programme held during the International Theatre Festival of Kerala (ITFoK)

title: Koppal bandh call against proposed steel plant evokes good response
content: Abhinava Gavisiddeshwar Swamy of Gavi Mutt takes the lead in opposing the factory planned in the vicinity of the city

title: Poet Balachandran Chullikkad appeals to exclude his poems from syllabus
content: Answers reportedly written by Plus One students to a question based on his poem Sandarshanam that triggered the latest fervent plea from the poet.

title: Kerala to set up fatty liver clinics in district hospitals
content: Metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease is on the rise in significant proportion of the population. If not detected and treated early through diet, lifestyle modification and exercise, fatty liver can progress to liver cirrhosis or liver cancer.

title: R.G. Kar rape and murder case: CBI submits status report in Sealdah court
content: Sanjay Roy, accused of committing rape and murder of the postgraduate trainee, was convicted of the charges and sentenced to life imprisonment till death on January 20

title: Magnitude 5.1 earthquake strikes Bay of Bengal
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'You cannot have trade wars with China, Europe at the same time': Macron warns US
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. title: India abstains on UNGA resolution calling for de-escalation, peaceful resolution of Ukraine war

title: Ant caps furious Wolves rally with block on SGA
content: Anthony Edwards blocked Thunder star Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's go-ahead shot attempt in overtime, capping a 25-point second-half comeback for the Timberwolves.

title: 'Incredible' Jokic dishes career-high 19 assists
content: Denver's Nikola Jokic had a career-best 19 assists -- his 28th career game with at least 15 assists, the most by a non-guard in NBA history -- while adding 18 points and nine rebounds as the Nuggets defeated the Indiana Pacers 125-116 on Monday night.

title: Unidentified NFL team proposes tush push ban
content: An NFL team has submitted a rule proposal to ban the "tush push" quarterback sneak, Troy Vincent, the NFL's executive vice president of football operations, told reporters at the scouting combine Monday.

title: Pass rusher Carter won't work out at combine
content: Penn State defensive end/outside linebacker Abdul Carter will not work out at the NFL's scouting combine this week because of a shoulder injury.

title: Guardians owner Dolan, 94, dies, team announces
content: Lawrence J. Dolan, owner of Cleveland's major league baseball team since 2000, has died at age 94, the Guardians announced in a statement on Monday, adding that Dolan died Sunday night of natural causes.

title: Galatasaray to report Mourinho for 'racist' remarks
content: Turkish Süper Lig leaders Galatasaray said they will "initiate criminal proceedings" and report Fenerbahçe manager Jose Mourinho to FIFA and UEFA over what they call "racist statements."

title: 'Selectively aggressive' Cowboys eye free agency
content: Speaking to reporters at the NFL scouting combine Monday in Indianapolis, Dallas Cowboys executive vice president Stephen Jones said the club will be "selectively aggressive" in free agency this winter, adding "we're going to look at everything we can."

title: Stanford AD Muir expected to resign, sources say
content: Stanford athletic director Bernard Muir is expected to resign from his position, sources told ESPN, after 13 years at the school.

title: 8 Trapped In Telangana Tunnel For 72 Hours, Excavation Halts Due To Slush
content: Eight people were trapped when a section of a tunnel in Telangana's Nagarkurnool district collapsed on Saturday morning.

title: Overtaking Or Highway Chase? BJP vs Trinamool Over What Killed Bengal Woman
content: The death of a 27-year-old woman in Bengal's Paschim Bardhaman on Monday has led to a spat between the Trinamool and the BJP, with the latter's Sukunta Majumdar, slamming Mamata Banerjee for making Bengal a "living hell for women".

title: Watch: Macron Interrupts Trump After Remark Over Ukraine Aid
content: During a joint press conference, Emmanuel Macron interrupted Donald Trump when he claimed that Europe was merely loaning Ukraine money and would get it back.

title: Canada's New Visa Rules May Become A Nightmare For Indian Students, Workers
content: Canada's latest steps to curb migration is likely to have an adverse effect on tens of thousands of foreign students, including those from India. It will also negatively impact those who apply for work and resident permits.

title: Team Trump Asks Agencies To Ignore Elon Musk's "Justify-Your-Job" Mail
content: Ahead of the Monday deadline, the Trump administration in the United States is reportedly backing off from Elon Musk's weekend mandate for all government employees to submit five things they accomplished in the last week or face dismissal.

title: "War Could End By...": Trump Hints Zelensky Is Ready To Sign Minerals Deal
content: US President Donald Trump has invited his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelensky for a meeting in Washington to sign a deal on critical minerals and suggested that the war between Russia and Ukraine could end "within weeks".

title: Another change at No. 1 and what's next for every Top 25 team
content: What's new in the latest AP women's basketball Top 25 and what's ahead as the regular season winds down.

title: How NC State upset No. 1 Notre Dame, how it impacts NCAA seeds
content: The Wolfpack guards outplayed their Irish counterparts to climb to a 2-seed. Is Notre Dame still a No. 1?

title: 'This is a meat-and-potatoes draft': NFL scouts on the strengths, weaknesses and depth of the 2025 class
content: With only a handful of high-end prospects, the 2025 draft class has been criticized and questioned. But scouts are actually intrigued by the group's depth.

title: 'I think our pitching is going to surprise people': Can the Mets' rotation quiet the critics again?
content: The Mets opted for short-term deals and risks for their starting rotation again. And, like last season, there are questions.

title: Man Utd announce up to 200 more redundancies
content: Manchester United have announced plans to make up to another 200 staff redundant as part of their continuing cost-cutting measures.

title: Van Dijk wants to make Anfield 'horrible' in run-in
content: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk has urged supporters to make Anfield "horrible" for opponents in the coming months as his team seek to get their Premier League title challenge over the line.

title: Sources: Vitor Roque loan to Palmeiras likely off
content: Vitor Roque's transfer from Barcelona to Palmeiras is set to fall through due to the Royal Spanish Football Federation's [RFEF] regulations which prevent Real Betis cutting his loan short, various sources have told ESPN.

title: Neymar scores direct from corner: 'I meant it'
content: Neymar showed he still has plenty of magic left after a long injury layoff by scoring from a corner while being jeered by opposing fans.

title: 2025 KTM 390 Adventure Review; Best ADV Under 500 cc?
content: We finally get on the saddle and ride the highly anticipated new-generation KTM 390 Adventure in the sunny and beautiful state of Goa and well, it has been a revelation in every sense of the word. Why you ask? Read our comprehensive review and find out.

title: India Getting 'Unfair' Venue Advantage In CT 2025? Cummins' Honest Verdict
content: After refusing to play in Pakistan, citing security concerns, India are playing their matches at the Dubai International Stadium under a hybrid model.

title: Dramatic Video Shows Bridge Collapse In South Korea, 2 Killed
content: Two people died, four were seriously injured and one suffered a minor injury, according to a statement from the National Fire Agency.

title: Pakistan Staring At Huge Financial Trouble Over Early CT 2025 Exit: Report
content: Pakistan cricket is on the ropes yet again, and this time, even attracting sponsors for the men's national team could become a challenge for the powers that be after the abysmal outing in the Champions Trophy.

title: 'Reply To Job Mail Or Get Fired': Elon Musk's 2nd Chance To Federal Workers
content: Elon Musk said that federal workers will be given a second opportunity to respond to a government-wide email detailing what they did last week, and threatened to fire any employee who doesn't meet his demands.

title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif Says He'll "Defeat India", Stakes His Name On It
content: Pakistan's prime minister Shehbaz Sharif finds himself in a spot of bother after making a claim that might cost him his name.

title: Kerala Man Kills 5 Family Members, Lover, Mother In Critical Condition
content: In a shocking incident, a 23-year-old man on Monday confessed to the police in Venjaramoodu, near here, that he had killed six people including his 13-year-old brother, his grandmother in her 80s, and a young woman said to be his lover.

title: India Getting 'Unfair' Venue Advantage In CT 2025? Cummins' Honest Verdict

title: Liverpool's Salah breaks records in win vs. City
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has become the first player in Europe's top five leagues to surpass 50 direct goal involvements this season.

title: Tebas: Real Madrid must stop 'crying' over refs
content: LaLiga president Javier Tebas has accused Real Madrid of "crying" and creating a "global conspiracy theory" with their constant criticism of officiating in Spain.

title: Flick hopeful Yamal is fit to face Atleti in Copa
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick is optimistic Lamine Yamal will be fit to face Atlético Madrid in the first leg of the Copa del Rey semifinal at the Olympic Stadium on Tuesday.

title: Ukraine's wounded find love, hope in soccer: 'Shakhtar is bringing me back to life'
content: The players on Shakhtar Stalevi, a team of Ukrainian amputees formed in 2024, have been greatly impacted by the full-scale Russian invasion. But they've gained a purpose, and new life, through soccer.

title: Liverpool title push continues, Napoli lose again, Modric magic for Madrid
